comment: He can be very condescending and rude. Make sure you know your algebra and are prepared to participate in class, otherwise he will berate the whole class. He is kind-ish, personality-wise, but I will never take this professor again

I think he's a really nice person, but he's a really tough grader on tests. For example, I got the correct answer on the exam but didn't do the problem in the way he wanted, so I didn't get any points. His homework is also around an hour long each, and they're three times a week with little weight to grade. He also doesn't explain very well.

STAY AWAY! 5-10 hours of homework a week, weekly quizzes in-class. Tough grader. Doesn't explain concepts well. Often makes fun of students for not understanding things. Just a very unpleasant time overall. wouldn't recommend to anyone.

re-took calc 2 with a different professor and finished with a 98. Was failing his. Don't take this prof.
Absolute cuck. Gets pegged by his wife or sum.
Auraless, bad haircut, big and pudgy, sort of smelly, flies coming from sweaty armpits, broke several chairs from weight, would not take again unless I wanted to lobotomize myself
Horrible, avoid at all costs.

I'd take him again, but only because I'm familiar with the way he grades. I believe villanueva genuinely wants to see his students succeed, but he's at times harsh and condescending.

There is a lot of homework. Each homework assignment takes about 1-3 hours depending on the topic.

Quiz every Friday on whatever you learned that given week.

Many of my classmates complained about him, but I think the problem many people had was adjusting to the college workload. Good amount of homework, and taking notes in class was pretty much needed, but he was really nice and very good at explaining concepts. I struggled bad in the beginning, but he gave opportunities for extra credit at the end.

Fall 2024. Quizzes every Friday(10%), hw 3x week: takes 1h30. Many say he grades very harshly. Average student failed almost every exam.I showed up to class, did the hw/the suggested problems from book, & went to office hours when needed. If ur lazy, I wouldn't register for him.Tests are up to 110 points (out of 100)!Final replaced 1 exam if helps.

His lectures are very difficult to understand, and the homework is very long while counting for very little towards your grade. He provides a lot of resources online, so I managed to learn from those resources instead of him. Unless if you feel comfortable teaching for yourself an entire semester, and believe you are an elite test taker, AVOID HIM!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I took him for a summer, absolutely do not take precalc in the summer unless you're a genius. He didnt explain things well, but I wouldn't put all the blame on him, the class was 2hrs and 45 mins, 3 times a week but he just didnt explain things enough. Take Prof. Robert Burnham!!!!!!!

There was Pearson homework due before every class, which was time consuming, but it was helpful because it was similar to the exams and quizzes. Each exam was worth about 20% of your overall grade, so his class is difficult if you are not a good test taker. As for his lectures, he taught at a very good pace and he covered many examples thoroughly.

The professor does offer extra credit at the beginning of the year. Attendance is taken, but not required. There are quizzes every Friday unless stated otherwise. There is a heavy load of homework which usually takes an hour or more. Partial credit is barely given, you either get it right or wrong. Make sure to show at least some work for everythin

Extremely hard grader with little to no chance for partial credit. one extremely small mistake during the process will cost you half credit or more even if you get the correct answer. He assumes you already know how to do the problems off of one example and you will have homework due every time you meet for class. (each one is 1-1.5 hrs+)

Good at teaching the concepts but very strict and inconsistent when it comes to grading. Does offer test retakes but retakes are harder than normal tests. Plus with his harsh grading, odds are the retakes won't be too helpful. Class examples are easier than what's on hw so you'll have to spend several hours struggling through hw, and there's a lot.

Attendance is not mandatory, but he does take it. He explains the concept, does two very simple example and then you have to struggle through homework. He gives partial credit on tests somewhat, but if you don't do all of his steps, get the right answer, or show all the work he wants, you get less than half credit.

What I will say is that this professor took his job seriously and he explained the chapters really well, but he is an extremely tough grader. You may not pass the class, but you'll understand the concepts behind each chapter.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Quiz every Friday. HW are given after each class and are due by the following class. There are three exams (option for a retake). Do the homework and practice the extra problems provided in the online textbook after each section, as questions from these may also appear on quizzes and exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Very harsh grader, will always take more then 10 points off every mistake which will result me in getting 70-80 on every test and fail every quiz. Quiz every Friday, hw every class. Very good at teaching but harsh

This professor is very strict on learning the material properly, but he gives a lot partial credit and good feedback. He has a quiz almost every Friday, but if you put in the effort he teaches so that you understand the material and remember it as well.

Cohesive lectures, lots of homework, anywhere between 3-6+ hours a week, but the homework prepares you for the quizzes and exams very well if you take it seriously. He always gave multiple attempts or extra credit on exams and is willing to work with you extending homework or rescheduling quizzes. Attendance is taken but not a part of your grade.

Very passionate about math. His calc 2 class can be pretty difficult in terms of content, but he makes it super manageable. Grades on a "curve" where he offers more than 100 points on an exam and takes how many points you got as your grade & offers retakes for exams. Homework each class, which are completion grades and worth more than quizzes.

Don't let these reviews scare you. He's actually so sweet and good at teaching the content. Calc 2 is tough, but you do enough practice that you get a good understanding of it. Lots of homework, but you get used to it. Your grade is test heavy and he does take points off for little things, but he offers retakes for every exam.

Overall I think we was a solid Professor. He made the class harder that way you had an easier time during the Finals.  Had tons of opportunity to make up points for quizzes and tests outside of class. If you show up and put in effort then you should be good.

Professor Alfredo was honestly one of the nicest professors I've had. Allowed exam retakes, and took the higher grade of the two. 3 homework assignments are due every week, but if you miss any of them he'll gladly reopen them for full credit back. Attendance is taken during every class, but it's not mandatory simply for his own gauge.

Not the best teacher but he's not the worst. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities to make up points on quizzes and retake tests. There is homework after about every single class. Using the book's practice questions and Professor Leonard on Youtube helped a lot.

Prof Villanueva is a tough grader, but makes up for it in extra credit opportunities. He also gives you the whole semester to improve quiz grades. Most homework assignments are long, but prepare you well for the tests/quizzes. And he always does recaps of what you should have learned in previous courses before he introduces new topics.

He explains more of the "why" rather than the "how" for each concept. The lack of review is annoying, quizzes are given almost every Friday (3-4 questions each), so if you miss one you're at a 75%. However, he does give the opportunity to retake quizzes/exams for points. Only downside to this is that the retakes are much harder than the original.

Do not take this professor at all costs. He assigns homework after every class and it's super time consuming. He also has quizzes every week and they're usually only 3 or 4 questions so if you miss one, you will pretty much already by failing. If you don't work out the problems his way and if you even get it right, he'll take off full points.

Homework is due at the beginning of each class, you would think oh it's just 20 problems right.. wrong it has parts ranging from a-k or a little less. 
Had to teach myself the material. That says a lot about a professor. 
Quizzes every week!!!! (only contains like a few problems miss one thats -30pts miss another -20pts)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Give him a chance. It took me until the end of the semester to realize he just has a different teaching style than most professors. He really focuses on the WHY rather than the how. Homework assigned after each class, but was typically easy to complete. Quizzes every two weeks. He was always willing to help outside/after class.

Took Prof. Villanueva for Math 3260 in Fall 2021. It was a pretty chill environment - his lectures werent perfect but his exams and expectations were totally reasonable. Also dude was fun. For reference I'm now taking linear algebra at GT and im struggling with a C when i got an easy A here. dont take this man for granted it could be so much worse

Most of these are just people complaining. Thought he was hard at first, but calculus is just hard. Gave us plenty of things to help. I started doing really well once i actually used his resources. He was very helpful during his office hours, he has all his lecture notes posted online, gave retakes on almost everything and extra credit sometimes.

He tried to be helpful but between the language barrier and the insane amount of work, I wouldn't recommend. He curved grades at the end of the semester and offered makeup tests but the makeup was always 10x harder than the original. Homework is due at the beginning of each class and some of it takes forever. Worst I have ever done in a class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: At the beginning of the semester I thought he was a hard teacher. But in reality its just a hard class. We have three tests seven quizzes and homework assigned every class. However the real special part about Alfredo that makes him unique is that he really cares for his students he lets us retake every test and quiz then curves the final grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: weekly quizzes 10%, homework 10%, 4 tests 80% of the grade. He lets you retake the tests and some quizzes if the grades are low, but everything on the test is significantly harder than homework and class lectures.

I have never gotten a C in a class and this is probably going to be my first. He is a nice guy and does try to help you and he let us retake each exam, but the questions are much much harder than anything we ever learned. I would strongly advise you to take a different class
Do not take. Take literally any other calc professor. This is coming from someone that has one of the better grades in his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Not the worst, not the best, avoid if you can but if you cant make sure you study the textbook problems, the weekly quizzes are usually problems taken straight from the book. Rarely gives partial credit
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Avoid at all cost. He is knowledgeable on Calc however he fails at translating it to the students. PPT base lecture that are easy but the HW, QZ, & TST are something else. His syllabus mention that no drop or retakes but we had a retake for everything far. No partial credit, Hard to reach out of class, only 17 people left in class after drop.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you ever have this teacher I advise you to drop his class immediately.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Look Ill be honest, hes not the absolute worst teacher ever because I have seen a lot of bad teachers, but not everyone has a good skill set in math. This teacher I particular can teach decently, and what he teaches is on the test but the problem is the test questions are much harder than what we practice on class work. I would highly avoid him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He cant explain anything. And if he does explain anything he skips steps. Not a very good lecturer.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I wouldn't say he's the worst professor I have ever had but he is up there. He's a tough grader. Most of the things he teaches would be on a test but on a whole other difficulty. I recommend not taking this class just to save your grade. You won't pass with an A or even a B...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: lots of homework. tough grader. weekly quizzes. tough exams. hard to reach outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Tests take up 80% of the grade and are very hard. He's not very good at explaining simple concepts sometimes. He's a very harsh grader and grades on very minute and small things. If you don't work out a problem his way on a test, he will mark you wrong regardless of whether you got it right or not. Just don't take his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Has quizzes every single week, but refuses to go over them in class even if we ask. Takes points off on the most minimal things, things that wouldnt even take away from the understanding of the problem/answer. If you miss a class youll be completely lost. I had the time to really dedicate myself to this class, but if you dont then do not take it
